doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Psuedo-peripheral to perform memory initialisation for an ARM based Linux kernel boot: Loads Linux kernel image file and (optional) initial ram disk image into memory. Writes ATAG data into memory. Writes tiny boot code at physical memory base that configures the registers as expected by Linux Kernel and then jumps to boot address (image load address by default).

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: See ARM Linux boot requirements in Linux source tree at documentation/arm/Booting

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Master port - connect to same bus connected to Linux processor's data port

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Name of the the Linux kernel image file (e.g. zImage) to load. (required)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Address to load the Linux kernel image file (default: physicalbase+0x00010000)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Name of the initial ram disk file to load. (optional)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Address to load the initial ram disk file (default: physicalbase+0x00d00000)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Address to write Linux ATAGS data (default: physicalbase+0x100)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The physical address of the base of memory. (default: 0)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The size of memory in bytes. (default: 128M)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Set command line passed to kernel. (optional)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Append to the command line passed to kernel. (optional)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The boardid passed to the kernel. (default: ArmIntegrator value = 0x113)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The stackpointer passed to the kernel. (default: memsize+physicalbase)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Address to call from smart Loader's tiny startup code (default: kerneladdr)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Set to True to disable the smart loader
